phases.name: Generate Test Rides
messaging: Book a Test Ride Social Post (Instagram & Facebook)

messages.title: Launch Announcement Email
messages.content:
Subject: The new BMW R 1300 R just landed

Dear [Name],

The genie is out of the bottle. The all-new BMW R 1300 R has arrived - a versatile naked bike that adapts to your every desire.

With its powerful 1300cc Boxer engine delivering 145hp of pure excitement, this isn't just another motorcycle. It's sexy versatility personified. Sharp design meets dynamic performance, creating a bike that's sportier than ever yet suitable for any occasion.

Key highlights:
- Lighter than before at just 239kg
- Dynamic ESA suspension as standard
- Keyless Ride for ultimate convenience
- Sport-focused ergonomics with comfort options

Be among the first to experience the R 1300 R. Book your exclusive preview today.

**[Reserve Your Test Ride]**

Your BMW Motorrad Team

messages.title: Pre-Launch Teaser WhatsApp
messages.content:
🏍️ The new R 1300 R is here!

The genie has been unleashed - sexy versatility meets Boxer punch. Ready to experience exactly what you want from a motorcycle?

- ✅ 145hp of pure performance
- ✅ Sportier than ever
- ✅ Your style, your way

Reply YES for exclusive first-look details!

messages.title: Facebook Launch Post
messages.content:
🔥 INTRODUCING THE NEW BMW R 1300 R 🔥

The Genie is out! Our most versatile naked bike just got even better. 

With 145hp of Boxer power, Dynamic ESA suspension, and a sharp new design that turns heads, the R 1300 R delivers exactly what you want - whether that's carving corners or cruising boulevards.

#BMW #R1300R #BMWMotorrad #SexyVersatility #BornForTheCurve

[Link to website]

messages.content:

messages.title: Launch Announcement Email
messages.content:
Subject: The new BMW R 1300 RT just landed

Dear [Name],

Be in full command. The all-new BMW R 1300 RT is here - the hidden champion that delivers ultimate expertise for the most discerning riders.

With 145hp from the legendary 1300cc Boxer engine, advanced technology including Riding Assistant with front and rear radar, and the revolutionary DCA suspension, this is touring supremacy redefined. Despite its comprehensive capabilities, the RT appears lighter and more dynamic than ever.

Key highlights:
- 145hp Boxer power with refined delivery
- Riding Assistant as standard with ACC
- Audio System 2.0 included
- Variable luggage system available
- Revolutionary DCA suspension option

Command your journey. Book your exclusive preview today.

**[Reserve Your Test Ride]**

Your BMW Motorrad Team

messages.title: Launch Announcement Email
messages.content:
Subject: The new BMW R 1300 RS just landed

Dear [Name],

Turn your tour into a sports event. The all-new BMW R 1300 RS is here - a refined race tourer that brings persistent excitement to every mile.

With 145hp from the legendary 1300cc Boxer engine and a weight reduction to just 245kg, this is the sportiest RS we've ever created. Every second becomes a celebration of joy when you're carving through corners or conquering continents.

Key highlights:
- Lighter and more agile than ever at 245kg
- Dynamic ESA suspension as standard
- Riding Assistant with rear radar
- Sporty ergonomics with touring capability
- Iconic BMW split face design

Be among the first to experience the thrill. Book your exclusive preview today.

**[Reserve Your Test Ride]**

Your BMW Motorrad Team

messages.title: In-Store Feature Poster Copy
messages.content:
THE GENIE IS HERE

R 1300 R

SEXY VERSATILITY UNLEASHED
- 145hp Boxer Engine
- 239kg Lightweight Design
- Dynamic ESA Suspension
- Keyless Ride Standard

BORN FOR THE CURVE

Test Ride Today

messages.title: Key Features Talking Points Script
messages.content:
R 1300 R Customer Conversation Guide

Opening: ""The R 1300 R is our most versatile naked bike - we call it 'The Genie' because it delivers exactly what you want.""

Key Points:
1. Performance: ""145hp from the 1300cc Boxer engine gives you instant torque and that unique BMW character. It's sportier than ever but still comfortable for longer rides.""

2. Weight: ""At just 239kg, it's lighter and more agile - perfect for both city riding and weekend canyon carving.""

3. Technology: ""Dynamic ESA suspension adapts to your riding in real-time. Keyless Ride means you never fumble for keys.""

4. Versatility: ""Sport suspension and ergonomics when you want them, comfort options when you need them. It's your bike, your way.""

5. Design: ""That sharp, modern design isn't just for looks - every angle serves the riding experience.""

Closing: ""Would you like to experience this versatility yourself? I can arrange a test ride.""

messages.title: Digital Screen Copy
messages.content:
[Rotating Display]

Slide 1: R 1300 R - THE GENIE
""Sexy Versatility Unleashed""

Slide 2: PURE PERFORMANCE
145hp

messages.title: Key Features Talking Points Script
messages.content:
R 1300 RT Customer Conversation Guide

Opening: ""The R 1300 RT is The Commander - it puts you in full command with ultimate touring expertise. It's the hidden champion for discerning riders.""

Key Points:
1. Technology Leadership: ""Standard Riding Assistant with front and rear radar, ACC, and lane warnings. It's like having a co-pilot watching everything.""

2. Comfort Supremacy: ""Audio System 2.0 comes standard. Heated seats and grips warm in seconds. The optional DCA suspension adapts to any load or road automatically.""

3. Protection: ""Supreme wind and weather protection with adaptive deflectors. You arrive fresh after 500 miles.""

4. Practicality: ""24L tank, variable electronic luggage, smartphone charging - everything for commanding long distances.""

5. Hidden Performance: ""Don't let the comfort fool you - with 145hp and dynamic riding modes, this RT is sportier than ever.""

Closing: ""Would you like to experience what full command feels like? I can arrange a comprehensive test ride.""

messages.title: Key Features Talking Points Script
messages.content:
R 1300 RS Customer Conversation Guide

Opening: ""The R 1300 RS is the Marathon Racer - it turns every tour into a sports event with persistent excitement mile after mile.""

Key Points:
1. Performance: ""145hp from the 1300cc Boxer engine in our lightest RS ever at 245kg. It's the sportiest, most agile RS we've built.""

2. Design: ""That iconic BMW split face and dynamic flyline aren't just beautiful - they're functional, improving aerodynamics for high-speed touring.""

3. Technology: ""Riding Assistant with rear radar keeps you safe. Dynamic ESA adapts to any road. It's race technology for the real world.""

4. Ergonomics: ""Sportier riding position than ever before, but still comfortable for crossing continents. Lower, wider bars give you control and confidence.""

5. Versatility: ""From attacking mountain passes to eating up motorway miles - this bike makes every second a celebration of joy.""

Closing: ""Would you like to experience this persistent excitement yourself? I can arrange an extended test ride.""

messages.content:
Subject: Making your R 1300 R dream a reality

Hi [Name],

Thank you for your interest in the R 1300 R. I wanted to share some flexible ways to make this incredible machine yours:

Finance Options:
- HP: From £[XXX]/month with competitive rates
- PCP: Lower monthly payments with flexibility
- Personal loan: We work with multiple lenders

Current Offers:
- [£XXX] deposit contribution
- Complimentary first service
- Trade-in bonus evaluation

I can create a personalized quote based on your preferences. What works best for your budget?

**[Get My Quote]**

Best regards,
[Dealer name]

messages.title: Post-Test Ride Follow-Up Email
messages.content:
Subject: How was your R 1300 R experience?

Hi [Name],

I hope you enjoyed unleashing the genie yesterday! The R 1300 R certainly shows what 145hp of versatility feels like.

I'm curious - what impressed you most? The sporty handling? The comfortable ergonomics? The instant Boxer torque?

If you're ready to make it yours:
- We have [color] available for immediate delivery
- Special test ride discount of £[XXX] this week only
- Finance from £[XXX]/month

Any questions about specs, accessories, or options? I'm here to help make this exactly the bike you want.

**[Configure My R 1300 R]**

Looking forward to hearing from you!

[Dealer name]

messages.title: Special Offer Follow-Up Email
messages.content:

I wanted to make sure you didn't miss this - your exclusive R 1300 R offer expires in 48 hours:

Shall we secure yours today?

messages.title: Phone Follow-Up Script
messages.content:
R 1300 R Phone Follow-Up Script

Opening: ""Hi [Name], it's [Your name] from [Dealership]. I wanted to follow up on your interest in the R 1300 R - do you have a couple of minutes?""

Key Points:
1. Check interest: ""You were looking at the R 1300 R - what particularly caught your attention about it?""

2. Address concerns: ""Was there anything specific you wanted to know more about?""

3. Create urgency: ""I mention it because we have some great offers this month, including [specific offer].""

4. Test ride: ""Have you had a chance to test ride it yet? The 145hp really comes alive on the road.""

5. Next steps: ""I'd love to help you experience what this bike can do. Can we book you in for [test ride/another look/finance discussion]?""

Closing: ""I'll send you those details by email. Looking forward to seeing you soon!""

messages.title: Phone Follow-Up Script
messages.content:
R 1300 RT Phone Follow-Up Script

Opening: ""Hi [Name], it's [Your name] from [Dealership]. I wanted to follow up on your interest in the R 1300 RT Commander - do you have a moment?""

Key Points:
1. Check needs: ""You were looking at the RT - are you planning long-distance touring or looking for ultimate daily comfort?""

2. Address technology: ""Did you have any questions about the Riding Assistant or other technology features?""

3. Create urgency: ""We have an exceptional offer this month including complimentary DCA suspension worth £[XXX].""

4. Test ride: ""Have you experienced the RT's full command capabilities yet? The technology really needs to be experienced.""

5. Next steps: ""I'd love to help you configure your perfect touring command center. Can we schedule [extended test/specification session]?""

messages.title: Phone Follow-Up Script
messages.content:
R 1300 RS Phone Follow-Up Script

Opening: ""Hi [Name], it's [Your name] from [Dealership]. I wanted to follow up on your interest in the R 1300 RS Marathon Racer - do you have a couple of minutes?""

Key Points:
1. Check interest: ""You were looking at the R 1300 RS - what kind of riding adventures are you planning?""

2. Address needs: ""Are you looking for more sporty performance or touring capability? The RS delivers both brilliantly.""

3. Create urgency: ""We have some excellent offers this month, including a complimentary Touring Package worth £[XXX].""

4. Test ride: ""Have you experienced the RS yet? An extended test ride really shows its marathon capabilities.""

5. Next steps: ""I'd love to help you configure your perfect touring sports bike. Can we book you in for [extended test/specification discussion]?""

Closing: ""I'll send you those details by email. Looking forward to starting your marathon journey!""

guides.title: 🚀 Launch Communication Guide
guides.content:
# 🚀 Launch Communication Strategy Guide

**For**: R 1300 RT (KA3), R 1300 R (KA4), R 1300 RS (KA5)

---

## 🎯 Purpose

Help your dealership turn warm leads into customers by building launch excitement, tailoring comms by model, and driving actions like test rides and showroom visits.

---

## 🏁 At a Glance: Launch Key Points by Model

### R 1300 RT (KA3)
- **Character:** The Commander
- **Positioning:** *Be in Full Command*
- **Key Messages:** Ultimate Expertise / Hidden Champion / Beyond Zeitgeist
- **SOC Date:** 29 April 2025
- **Dealer Availability:** Early June 2025
- **Target Customers:** Touring experts, older loyalists, long-distance riders, comfort seekers, two-up riders
- **Comms Focus:** Dynamic performance + touring comfort + professional appeal
- **Hashtags:**
  - **Mandatory:** `#MakeLifeARide #R1300RT #RideAndShare #BMWMotorrad`
  - **Visual Realisation:** `#RECHARGE #RIDEANDSHARE`

### R 1300 R (KA4)
- **Character:** The Genie
- **Positioning:** *Sexy Versatility / Boxer Punch on Every Tarmac*
- **Key Messages:** Versatile Naked Bike / Born for the Curve / Beyond Zeitgeist
- **SOC Date:** 10 April 2025
- **Dealer Availability:** Early July 2025
- **Target Customers:** Boxer lovers, spontaneous riders, returners, women, style-conscious
- **Comms Focus:** Sporty freedom + design dynamism + agile experience
- **Hashtags:**
  - **Mandatory:** `#MakeLifeARide #R1300R #NeverStopChallenging #BMWMotorrad`
  - **Visual Realisation:** `#SHARPEN #NEVERSTOPCHALLENGING`
  - **Recommended:** `#R1300R`

### R 1300 RS (KA5)
- **Character:** The Marathon Racer
- **Positioning:** *Turn Your Tour into a Sports Event*
- **Key Messages:** Refined Race Tourer / Persistent Excitement / Beyond Zeitgeist
- **SOC Date:** 29 April 2025
- **Dealer Availability:** Early July 2025
- **Target Customers:** Sport-focused riders, tech lovers, younger audience, long-distance with edge
- **Comms Focus:** Sporty endurance + design-led appeal + performance leadership
- **Hashtags:**
  - **Mandatory:** `#MakeLifeARide #R1300RS #RideAndShare #BMWMotorrad`
  - **Visual Realisation:** `#SHARPEN #NEVERSTOPCHALLENGING`
  - **Recommended:** `#R1300RS`

---

## 🚀 Dealer Action Steps

### Access Launch Assets
→ Find CGI/AI videos and imagery in the Assets section, or your designated platform

### Use AI Content Responsibly
→ In the EU, label AI-generated assets clearly (e.g., "Background processed with the help of AI"). Check your market's legal requirements.

### Plan Your Comms Calendar
→ Align outreach with each model's timeline using pre-launch teasers, SOC announcements, and arrival updates.

### Segment Your CRM
→ Identify likely buyers:
  - **RT:** Previous RT, K 1600 GT owners
  - **R:** R 1250 R, returners, female riders
  - **RS:** R 1250 RS, sports tourer fans, younger prospects

### Customise Messaging
→ Use provided templates to tailor your outreach:
  - Emphasise comfort and control for **RT**
  - Highlight agility and design for **R**
  - Promote sporty performance and endurance for **RS**

### Activate Your Social Channels
- Access and decide on the available imagery and video content
- Use mandatory and recommended hashtags
- Share in correct formats (feeds, reels, stories)
- Spark engagement (e.g., "Which route would you race on the RS?")
- Use BMW's Social Media Best Practice Guide

### Be Ready to Talk Features
→ Practice a few talking points per model focused on new benefits:
  - New 1300cc Boxer engine
  - Lighter, more dynamic design
  - Enhanced ergonomics
  - Features like DCC, ASA, Riding Assistant

---

## ✅ Quick Reference Checklist

- [ ] Download image & video assets
- [ ] Check AI asset label requirements
- [ ] Review each model's timeline
- [ ] Segment CRM by model interest
- [ ] Customise and schedule emails
- [ ] Plan and post social content with correct hashtags
- [ ] Prepare 2–3 talking points per model
- [ ] Highlight key features in-store and online

guides.title: 🎥 Tips for Recording Video Walkarounds
guides.content:
# 🎥 Tips for Recording Video Walkarounds

**For iPhone and Android | Social Media & WhatsApp Ready**

These video recording tips are intended to produce results that are good enough for social media purposes (Instagram, Facebook) and also WhatsApp.

---

## ✅ Key Takeaways:

- Shoot in portrait for Instagram Reels/TikTok/WhatsApp
- Enable grid lines to keep the bike centred.
- Use a gimbal if available, but most new phones have good stabilization.
- Keep audio clear – speak close to the mic or use a plug-in microphone for better sound.
- Clean the lens before filming!

---

## 📝 Before You Start

- Use a phone from 2020 or newer  
  _(iPhone 11+, Samsung S20+, Pixel 5+, etc.)_
- Clean your camera lens
- Choose a quiet location with natural light  
  _Sun behind the camera, not in front of the bike_
- Set camera to 1080p or 4K at 30fps
- Turn on gridlines to centre your shots

---

## 📍 Location & Setup

- Shoot away from roads, crowds, or noisy environments
- Use non-reflective backgrounds and avoid capturing other people
- Avoid strip lighting if possible
- Check no reflections show the camera operator in windows/panels
- Choose a location with natural light

---

## 🎙️ Audio Quality

- Test before recording — play back a clip
- Avoid background noise like phones, tables or chairs moving, background chatter, etc.
- If using a mic, try:
  - Rode VideoMic GO
  - Movo Lapel Mic

---

## 🎥 Camera Settings & Consistency

- Use the same lighting, angle, and position if filming multiple bikes
- DSLR users: shoot at 4K or 1080p / 30fps with a 50mm or 85mm lens
- Use gimbals for smooth handheld shots (DJI OM)

---

## 🎬 Recording Format

**Intro**
> _"Hi, I'm [Name] at [Dealership]. Here's the [Bike Model, Year, Colour]!"_

**Walkaround**
- Show full bike, then highlight key features
- Speak naturally, pause between features
- Use hand gestures to point at parts (POV style)

**Closing**
> _"Come check it out in person or message us to book a ride!"_

---

## 🎤 What to Say

- Start with bike basics: make, model, year, colour
- Walk through features that you love or that stand out visually
- Pause between sentences to make edits easier
- Use hand gestures to highlight features, as if guiding the viewer
- Show personality: speak with energy, humour, and curiosity
- Be conversational and energetic, yet informative.

---

## 🧠 Pro Tips

- Keep it to under 1 minute
- Be conversational, energetic, and authentic
- Smile while talking – it comes through in your voice
- Don't worry about perfection

---

## ✂️ Editing

- Not necessary for most clips — aim for one clean take
- If editing, trim the start/end for smooth transitions and any 'umms' or stutters
- Keep the final cut to under 60–90 seconds

---

## 🎥 Optional Tools

- Tripod or phone stabiliser for smoother footage
- Use Cinematic mode (iPhone 13+) or Video Enhancer (Samsung)

---

## 🧑‍⚖️ Permissions

- If no people appear, no permission is needed
- If people are in frame, get written consent:
  - Name, company, job title, signature, date
  - Declare they're happy to appear in marketing content

guides.title: 🎞️ Social Media Video Editing
guides.description: Complete guide for editing BMW R-Series footage into engaging social media clips
guides.content:
# 🎞️ Social Media Video Editing Guide

**For R 1300 RT / R / RS Launch Campaigns**

This guide provides quick, practical tips to help dealership teams adapt and post provided video assets (teasers, walkarounds, product features, etc.) to their own social channels. The aim: drive launch interest and convert views into test rides and dealership visits.

---

## 📂 Accessing Your Video Assets

- Video content is available in Falcon Social from each model's **Start of Communication (SOC)** date.
- AI/CGI can be found on the **Messaging tab** of this website.
- **Do not post before each model's SOC date** — assets remain confidential until then.

---

## 🧱 Understanding Formats

Your video assets are supplied in various formats suited to different platforms:

| Format | Use For |
|--------|---------|
| **16:9** | Facebook feed, YouTube, LinkedIn (ideal for walkarounds & product features) |
| **9:16** | Instagram Reels, TikTok, Stories (vertical-first platforms) |
| **4:5** | Instagram & Facebook feed posts (high impact visual format) |

---

## 🛠️ Core Editing Tips

- **🎣 Hook Early:** Grab attention in the first 3–5 seconds. Start with a visually striking moment or key message.
- **✂️ Keep It Short:** Target lengths:
  - Teasers/highlights = 15–30 sec
  - Walkarounds = 60 sec
- **🔇 Sound Off Ready:** Many scroll without audio. Use text overlays or subtitles to share key points.
- **🛍️ Branding:** Add your dealership logo subtly and follow BMW Motorrad visual guidelines.
- **Model-Specific Storytelling:** Reinforce each bike's unique identity:

### RT (KA3)
- **Character:** The Commander
- **Positioning:** *Be in Full Command*
- **Key Messages:** Ultimate Expertise, Hidden Champion, Beyond Zeitgeist
- **Highlight:** Long-distance comfort, weather protection, "professional tool" image

### R (KA4)
- **Character:** The Genie
- **Positioning:** *Sexy Versatility / Boxer Punch on Every Tarmac*
- **Key Messages:** Versatile Naked Bike, Born for the Curve, Beyond Zeitgeist
- **Highlight:** Agility, design, accessibility, short-trip appeal

### RS (KA5)
- **Character:** The Marathon Racer

- **Positioning:** *Turn Your Tour Into a Sports Event*

- **Key Messages:** Refined Race Tourer, Persistent Excitement, Beyond Zeitgeist

- **Highlight:** 80/20 sports-to-touring blend, premium ride dynamics

- **🔍 Feature Focus**: Use close-ups to show key features like:
  - 1300cc Boxer engine
  - DCC, ASA, Riding Assistant
  - Keyless Ride
  - RT's luggage system or R's handlebar-end mirrors
  - Follow the FFB rule: Feature → Function → Benefit*

- **📢 CTA**: End every video with a clear call to action:  
*"Book a test ride," "Message us now," "Visit our showroom," etc.*

- **🤖 AI Labelling**: If any footage includes AI-generated backgrounds, label accordingly (e.g. "The background was processed with the help of AI"). Mandatory in many EU markets.

---

## 📱 Platform-Specific Tips

### Instagram / TikTok (9:16)
- Prioritise **Reels and Stories**
- Add text overlays (sound often off)
- Consider **trending audio**, where BMW guidelines permit
- Emphasise **emotion and visuals**, especially model personality

### Facebook / X / LinkedIn
- Use **4:5 or 16:9** for feed content
- Keep it short and text-friendly
- Highlight RT's "professional tool" appeal or RS's precision
- Add detailed context in the post caption

### YouTube
- Best for **long-form walkarounds (16:9)**
- Break longer content into **shorter clips** for other channels

---

## 🏷️ Hashtags

**Mandatory in all posts:**

1. `#MakeLifeARide`
2. `#R1300RT`, `#R1300R`, or `#R1300RS` (as relevant)
3. `#RideAndShare` (for RT and RS) or `#NeverStopChallenging` (for R)
4. `#BMWMotorrad`

**Also include:**
- Recommended model-specific tags like `#R1300R` where appropriate

---

## ✅ Quick Reference Checklist

- [ ] Select video assets suited to your platform and message
- [ ] Edit for conciseness (target under 30–60 seconds)
- [ ] Add text overlays/subtitles for sound-off viewing
- [ ] Include BMW and dealership branding
- [ ] Emphasise model-specific character + key messages
- [ ] End with a strong Call to Action (CTA)
- [ ] Add AI disclosure label (if needed)
- [ ] Check video aspect ratio is correct (9:16, 4:5, 16:9)
- [ ] Use all mandatory hashtags + relevant recommended tags
- [ ] (Optional) Add music — ensure it's rights-cleared

---

## 📚 Resources

**BMW Social Media Best Practice Guide**  
*(for detailed branding and platform guidelines)*

guides.title: 🏍️ Generating Test Rides from Your CRM Leads
guides.content:
# 🏍️ Generating Test Rides from Your CRM Leads

**Quick Reference Guide**

This guide provides practical tips for dealership sales teams to convert warm leads in your CRM—such as past enquirers and BMW Motorrad customers—into test ride bookings for the new **R 1300 RT (KA3), R (KA4), and RS (KA5)** models.

---

## 🎯 Goal

**Drive test ride bookings and in-store visits** by leveraging customer insights and model-specific storytelling.

---

## 🔍 Why Focus on CRM Leads?

Your CRM is a goldmine of warm prospects. These individuals:
- Already know your brand
- Are likely to respond to new model launches
- Have higher conversion potential than cold audiences

---

## ✅ Key Steps & Best Practices

### 1. Identify and Segment Your Warm Leads
- Use your CRM system to filter for leads most likely interested in a specific model.

**Prioritise:**
- Owners of previous **R 1250 RT/R/RS** models
- **GS** owners interested in more touring comfort (RT)
- **K 1600 GT** owners seeking a lighter tourer (RT)

**Segment by lifestyle/demographic:**
- **R:** Younger riders, returnees, women
- **RT:** Long-distance, mature touring riders
- **RS:** Dynamic riders who value tech and sporty handling

---

### 2. Tailor Your Communication (Email, Phone, Messaging)
Use each model's **Character and Positioning**:

**RT (KA3) – *The Commander***  
- **Positioning**: *Be in Full Command*
- **Key Messages:** Ultimate Expertise / Hidden Champion / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Highlight:** A professional tool for expert riders who value long-distance comfort, class, and control.

**R (KA4) – *The Genie***  
- **Positioning**: *Sexy Versatility / Boxer Punch on Every Tarmac*  
- **Key Messages:** Versatile Naked Bike / Born for the Curve / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Highlight:** A dynamic and agile all-rounder for commuting, after-work escapes, and weekend tours.

**RS (KA5) – *The Marathon Racer***  
- **Positioning**: *Turn Your Tour into a Sports Event*  
- **Key Messages:** Refined Race Tourer / Persistent Excitement / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Highlight:** A powerful sportbike with touring comfort — the most dynamic riding experience in the KAX family.

---

### 3. Translate Features into Benefits (FFB)
Explain **why** features matter using **Feature → Function → Benefit**:

- **1300cc Boxer engine:** Broad torque curve, relaxed or sporty ride

**RT highlights:**
- **DCA (Dynamic Chassis Adaption):** Comfort/dynamic settings, automatic load balancing
- **Riding Assistant:** ACC, SWW, rear warning
- **Variable luggage system and heated pillion package**

**R / RS highlights:**
- **DSA (Dynamic Suspension Adjustment)**
- **ASA (Automated Shift Assistant)**
- **Riding Assistant:** Radar front (R) / radar front + rear (RS)

**All models:** Improved ergonomics, more dynamic and modern design

---

### 4. Choose Appropriate Content and Visuals
- Use teasers, walkarounds, and product images from Falcon Social, DAM, or Google Drive
- Align visuals with the model's character:
    - Dynamic action shots for **R/RS**
    - Comfort-focused visuals for **RT**
- Add **AI-labels** to any AI-generated imagery (required in EU markets)

---

### 5. Craft a Clear Call to Action (CTA)
- Invite customers directly:  
    *“Book your test ride today.”*

- Make it easy:
    - Email reply
    -Website booking link
    -Phone call or message

- Encourage visits: 
    *“See it in person at our showroom.”*

---

### 6. Follow Up Consistently
- Plan follow-up actions in your workflow
- Be ready to answer FAQs about features, pricing, or availability
- Use the Product Guide to support detailed answers

---

### 7. Know Your Product (and the Assets)
- Be familiar with each model's positioning and selling points
- Know where to find the assets and how to use them effectively

---

## 📋 Quick Reference Checklist

- [ ] Segment CRM leads by model interest
- [ ] Tailor outreach using model character + benefits
- [ ] Highlight 2–3 key features with relevance
- [ ] Use visuals that support your message
- [ ] Ensure AI-labelling is present where required
- [ ] Include a clear CTA with easy next steps
- [ ] Schedule follow-up actions
- [ ] Know your product inside and out (via the Product Guide)

guides.title: 🛎️ In-Store Communication Guide
guides.content:
# 🛎️ In-Store Communication Guide: Reinforcing the R 1300 Models

This quick guide supports sales teams in delivering consistent, high-impact messaging for the **R 1300 RT (KA3), R (KA4), and RS (KA5)** across all dealership touchpoints — from posters to conversations. The goal is to seamlessly connect what customers have seen online with what they experience in-store.

---

## 🎯 Your Goal

Ensure every customer interaction — visual or verbal — reinforces the **core messaging** of the R 1300 launch, converting interest into **test rides and sales**.

---

## 💡 Why Consistency Matters

By the time customers enter the showroom, they may have already seen launch emails, social posts, and online videos.  
**Your in-store environment must echo these same themes to build trust, reinforce their excitement, and move them confidently to the next step.**

> _“Unclear or inconsistent messaging has been a known barrier in the past — clarity is now critical to success.”_

---

## 🧭 Key Principle: Align All Touchpoints (Pre-Visit & In-Store)

### 1. 🖼️ Visual Consistency
- Use only official BMW Motorrad **POS materials, posters, and on-screen content** from the launch asset library.
- Match the **visual style and imagery** to each model's identity:
  - **RT:** Modern, Unexpected & Fresh
  - **R:** Dynamic staging of sporty versatility
  - **RS:** Sport-touring energy and motion
- If you're using AI-generated content, ensure **AI background labeling** is visible — required in the EU and some markets.

---

### 2. 🗣️ Messaging Consistency
**Use the same talking points in-store that customers will have seen online:**

**RT (KA3) – *The Commander***  
- **Positioning**: *Be in Full Command*  
- **Key Messages**: Ultimate Expertise / Hidden Champion / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Focus on**: long-distance comfort, refined control, and "professional tool" status

**R (KA4) – *The Genie***  
- **Positioning**: *Sexy Versatility / Boxer Punch on Every Tarmac*  
- **Key Messages**: Versatile Naked Bike / Born for the Curve / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Focus on**: agile riding, daily practicality, dynamic styling

**RS (KA5) – *The Marathon Racer***  
- **Positioning**: *Turn Your Tour Into a Sports Event*  
**Key Messages**: Refined Race Tourer / Persistent Excitement / Beyond Zeitgeist  
- **Focus on**: sporty ride feel + long-distance capability

**Translate Features into Benefits**
Connect technical specs to real customer value:
- **1300cc Boxer engine** → torque + smooth power delivery
- **ASA / DSA / DCA** → comfort, adaptability, control
- **Heated seats, radar systems** → year-round comfort, safety, and premium experience

Use the tone and phrasing found in the official launch materials to keep everything "on brand."

---

### 3. 📢 Call to Action (CTA) Consistency
Every poster, screen, and conversation should make the **Test Ride** the obvious next step:

Use phrasing like:
> _"Want to feel the difference? Let's get you booked in."_  
> _"This bike's designed to be experienced — not just looked at."_

Ensure the test ride booking process is visible, easy, and encouraged at every point.

---

## 📋 Quick In-Store Checklist

- [ ] In-store visuals match current BMW Motorrad R 1300 assets
- [ ] AI content is clearly labelled where required
- [ ] Conversations reflect the official Character, Positioning, and Key Messages
- [ ] Features are explained in terms of real-world customer benefits
- [ ] Test Rides are promoted as the next step in every interaction
- [ ] Talking points align with what customers saw before entering the showroom (email, social, etc.)

guides.title: 📞 Post-Showroom Follow-Up Guide
guides.content:
# 📞 Post-Showroom Follow-Up Guide: Driving the Next Step

**For R 1300 RT / R / RS Prospects**

This guide outlines best practices for following up with potential customers after their dealership visit. Whether they looked, asked questions, or sat on a bike, your goal now is to build on that experience — reinforcing their interest and nudging them toward a test ride or purchase.

---

## 🎯 Your Goal

Convert showroom visitors into **test rides or sales** by following up in a way that reflects the consistent messaging they've seen and heard across all touchpoints.

---

## 🔁 Core Principle: Stay Consistent

Your follow-up message should reflect:
- The character and positioning of the model(s) they viewed
- The tone of previous communications
- What you discussed during their visit

Consistency builds trust and shows you listened.

---

## 🧩 Key Follow-Up Elements

### 1. Acknowledge the Visit
Start by thanking them for visiting and referencing the specific R 1300 model(s) they explored. Make it personal.

> _"Thanks for coming in to check out the new R 1300 RS — it was great chatting with you about your ideal long-distance ride."_

---

### 2. Reinforce What Stood Out
Mention one or two specific things they reacted to positively during your chat. This shows attention and builds rapport.

> _"You seemed especially drawn to the RS's aggressive stance and high-spec radar tech — totally understandable."_

---

### 3. Re-emphasise Benefits (FFB Style)
Connect features to their real-world value using **Feature → Function → Benefit**. Tailor this by model:

- **RT – The Commander**
  - Reinforce comfort, long-distance ability, and ride-in-control confidence.
  - Mention: Automated Shift Assistant, Comfort Passenger Package, Touring technology stack
- **R – The Genie**
  - Highlight its everyday flexibility, responsive handling, and confident design.
  - Mention: Boxer engine punch, low seat height, commute-to-weekend appeal
- **RS – The Marathon Racer**
  - Emphasise sport-touring balance and riding excitement.
  - Mention: Radar assistance front & rear, dynamic suspension, long-distance endurance with edge

  ---

### 4. Guide Them Clearly to the Next Step
Use a strong, direct **Call to Action**:

> _"Let's get you booked in for a test ride — it's the best way to experience it."_
> 
> _"Want to explore colours and spec options? I can walk you through the configurator or send you a link."_

If they've already test ridden:
- Offer to discuss financing, availability, or trade-in options.

---

## 📡 Choosing the Right Channel

### Email
- Great for detailed follow-up with links to the online **configurator or product page**
- Reinforce the model's character through tone and imagery
- Attach a spec sheet or highlight unique features again

### Text (SMS/WhatsApp)
- Ideal for a quick, **personal nudge**
- Keep it short and direct:
  > _"Great to meet you today — want to lock in a test ride this weekend?"_

### Phone Call
- Personal and high-impact
- Best for warm leads who showed serious interest
- Useful for answering questions, addressing hesitations, or guiding to purchase

---

## ✅ Post-Showroom Follow-Up Checklist

- [ ] Thank them for their visit
- [ ] Reference the specific bike(s) they saw
- [ ] Mention a personal takeaway from your conversation
- [ ] Highlight 1–2 benefits tied to their needs and the model's character
- [ ] Use a clear CTA (Book a Test Ride / Explore Configurations)
- [ ] Choose the right channel:
  - Email = detail
  - Phone = depth
  - Text = speed
- [ ] Keep messaging aligned with everything they've already seen

guides.title: 🛍️ Post-Purchase Welcome Guide
guides.content:
# 🛍️Post-Purchase Welcome Guide: Building Lasting Relationships

**For customers of the BMW R 1300 RT, R, and RS**

This guide reminds sales teams of simple, high-impact actions to deliver a premium welcome experience for new R 1300 owners. Your aim is to go beyond the sale — reinforcing their decision, enhancing satisfaction, and building long-term loyalty.

---

## 🎯 Your Goal

**Turn a happy buyer into a loyal advocate and repeat customer.**

---

## 🌟 Core Principle: Continue the BMW Experience

The BMW Motorrad journey doesn't stop at purchase.  
Your welcome should extend the **premium, expert, and personal** touch customers received during the sales process — always consistent with the bike's character and their riding lifestyle.

---

## ✅ Key Welcome Best Practices

### 1. 🧑‍🏫 Personalised Handover
- Spend time showing them key features **specific to their configuration**.
- Focus on innovations like:
  - **ASA (Automated Shift Assistant)**
  - **DSA/DCA (Dynamic Suspension Adaption/Chassis Adaption)**
  - **Riding Assistant radar features**
- Tailor your walk-through to the model's identity:
  - **RT** → command, comfort, control
  - **R** → versatility, agility
  - **RS** → sporty balance and ride precision

  ---

### 2. 🔁 Reinforce the "Why"
- Remind them why this model fits their riding needs and goals.
- Reference the **character** they connected with:
  - **RT – The Commander**
  - **R – The Genie**
  - **RS – The Marathon Racer**
- Reaffirm the value of their choice.

---

### 3. 🛠️ Introduce Service & Care
- Explain scheduled **maintenance plans** (e.g. Service Inclusive)
- Highlight **warranty extension options**
- Emphasise the benefits of servicing with the dealership:
  - Optimised performance
  - Peace of mind
  - Resale value

  ---

### 4. 🧳 Suggest Relevant Accessories
- Recommend accessories that match their usage (touring, sport, commuting):
  - **Luggage systems** (incl. electrified panniers, tank bags)
  - **Ergonomic options** (e.g. adjustable footpegs)
  - **BMW gear & protective clothing**
- Tie suggestions back to their needs and the bike's character.

---

### 5. 🌍 Invite Community Connection
- Mention local events, rider groups, or BMW Motorrad's online communities.
- Help them feel part of a broader community, not just a purchase.

---

### 6. 📬 Establish Future Contact
- Let them know you're available for questions.
- Set an expectation for a check-in — not just about upselling, but staying connected.
- Position the dealership as a long-term partner, not a one-time seller.

---

## 📋 Post-Purchase Welcome Checklist

- [ ] Provide a full, tailored handover with feature highlights
- [ ] Reaffirm the bike's fit for their preferences
- [ ] Introduce service, maintenance, and warranty options
- [ ] Recommend 1–2 personalised accessories
- [ ] Invite them to events, groups, or communities
- [ ] Set the tone for future contact and relationship-building
